title: Very strange async problem
body:
I'm getting a strange problem when the first use of chalk is in an async callback thread.
Node 0.12.6

```
[ReferenceError: builder is not defined]
ReferenceError: builder is not defined
    at Chalk.builder (c:\git\node-markdown-spellcheck\node_modules\chalk\index.js:40:27)
    at c:\git\node-markdown-spellcheck\es5\cli.js:221:58
    at c:\git\node-markdown-spellcheck\node_modules\async\lib\async.js:187:20
    at iterate (c:\git\node-markdown-spellcheck\node_modules\async\lib\async.js:265:13)
    at Object.async.forEachOfSeries.async.eachOfSeries (c:\git\node-markdown-spellcheck\node_modules\async\lib\async.js:284:9)
    at Object.async.forEachSeries.async.eachSeries (c:\git\node-markdown-spellcheck\node_modules\async\lib\async.js:220:22)
    at c:\git\node-markdown-spellcheck\es5\cli.js:219:26
    at c:\git\node-markdown-spellcheck\node_modules\async\lib\async.js:697:13
    at c:\git\node-markdown-spellcheck\node_modules\async\lib\async.js:52:16
    at done (c:\git\node-markdown-spellcheck\node_modules\async\lib\async.js:248:21)
```

I've looked at the code

```
    var builder = function builder() {
        return applyStyle.apply(builder, arguments);
    };
```

and I've no idea why it is going wrong - the function expression name should be exposed.

If I change the chalk code in my node_modules to...

```
    var builder = function () {
        return applyStyle.apply(builder, arguments);
    };
```

then it works.

If I add a dummy call to chalk before I start doing async things, it works

```
chalk.red("red"); // fix very weird bug
```

The only explanation I have is that its a weird V8 bug. I'm raising here in case there is something I missed, or you have seen it before or you had been thinking about removing the function name anyway.
